sentences.english: He wanted to see this grotesque sight, these dead bodies lying there.
sentences.chinese: 他想要看到這種怪誕的景像，這些屍體躺在那兒。

sentences.english: After the romance of the Ming and Qing novel, the ghost town appears more mystery to people.
sentences.chinese: 經明清小說的渲染，豐都鬼城更加神祕怪誕。

sentences.english: Bret : These movies were indebted to the carnival and the freak show.
sentences.chinese: 此類電影應該算是得益於狂歡節及怪誕異常的表演。

sentences.english: IT IS the strangest of courtroom dramas.
sentences.chinese: 這是一部最爲怪誕的法庭劇。

sentences.english: This is where even myths start getting weirder and weirder.
sentences.chinese: 這甚至是謬論變得越來越怪誕的源頭。

sentences.english: The most grotesque fantastic conceits haunted him in his bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚躺在牀上的時候，各種離奇怪誕的幻想紛至沓來。

sentences.english: Young people adapt quickly to the most absurd things.
sentences.chinese: 再怪誕的東西年輕人也能很快適應。

sentences.english: The scent of the Dark Umbra clings to them, adding to the eerie mystery that shrouds them.
sentences.chinese: 暗影界影響緊隨着他們，帶給他們怪誕的神祕氣息。

sentences.english: Does he call you at whacky times?
sentences.chinese: 難道他打電話給您，怪誕的時間？

sentences.english: Typical Use:The wall was covered with many fantastic pictures and photographs.
sentences.chinese: 這面牆蓋滿了許多怪誕的圖片和照片。

sentences.english: I mean,it would be totally bizarre. Things like this don't happen.
sentences.chinese: 這是非常怪誕的，這種事不可能發生。

sentences.english: Don't toe the line just as it is grotesque , left to the mercy of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要因它怪誕就俯首聽命，聽任它的擺佈。
非常怪誕的，拿破崙分成了兩個。

sentences.english: The no branching rule seems rather bizarre in its own right.
sentences.chinese: 無分支規則似乎本身就很怪誕。

sentences.english: The most grotesque and fantastic conceits haunted him in his bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚躺在牀上的時候，各種離奇怪誕的幻想紛至沓來。

sentences.english: Each description is no more than a few pages, but long enough to prompt eerie wonderings.
sentences.chinese: 每段故事不過幾頁，但夠長了足以引起對怪誕的好奇。

definition: to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
